unnormalised: The CBSE class 10th results are finally out! Everyone’s been prepping and praying, and now the marks are in. I remember my own results day; felt like ages ago, in 2010. Total nail-biting situation, especially when the website kept crashing ‘cause everyone was checking at the same time. Good luck to all the students who appeared. Hope you got the marks you wanted.
normalised: The C-B-S-E class tenth results are finally out! Everyone’s been prepping and praying, and now the marks are in. I remember my own results day; felt like ages ago, in two thousand and ten. Total nail-biting situation, especially when the website kept crashing because everyone was checking at the same time. Good luck to all the students who appeared. Hope you got the marks you wanted.

unnormalised: Speaking of marks, cut-offs for colleges are soaring these days. A friend’s daughter, Aisha, scored 92% in her ISC exams, but still wasn't sure of getting into the college of her choice for B.Com. It’s just gotten so competitive! Remember the days when 70% was considered brilliant? Now, 90% seems to be the new normal. My dad used to say scoring over 60% meant you were set for life! Things have changed a lot since then.
normalised: Speaking of marks, cut-offs for colleges are soaring these days. A friend’s daughter, Aisha, scored ninety two percent in her I-S-C exams, but still wasn't sure of getting into the college of her choice for B dot Com. It’s just gotten so competitive! Remember the days when seventy percent was considered brilliant? Now, ninety percent seems to be the new normal. My dad used to say scoring over sixty percent meant you were set for life! Things have changed a lot since then.

unnormalised: The grading system’s changed too, right? Now they have this CGPA thing, where a 10 CGPA is supposed to be the top score. Back in my day, it was just out of 100, plain and simple. Someone told me that a CGPA of 8.5 is roughly equivalent to 80%, but honestly, I still get confused by all the conversions. Also, these days I see that students take coaching for the exams, and that’s something that my generation wasn’t really doing.
normalised: The grading system’s changed too, right? Now they have this C-G-P-A thing, where a ten C-G-P-A is supposed to be the top score. Back in my day, it was just out of one hundred, plain and simple. Someone told me that a C-G-P-A of eight point five is roughly equivalent to eighty percent, but honestly, I still get confused by all the conversions. Also, these days I see that students take coaching for the exams, and that’s something that my generation wasn’t really doing.

unnormalised: Also, don't stress too much if the results aren't exactly what you hoped for. There are so many options now – different streams, vocational courses, everything! My nephew flunked Physics, but ended up becoming an awesome graphic designer. Life has its own way of sorting things out. There is also the matter of re-evaluation, which I’ve heard can potentially increase your marks. I remember having a friend that went from 70 to 74 in Maths after his paper was rechecked.

unnormalised: So, to all the students, congratulations on finishing this chapter! Whether you scored 99% or just barely passed, you've made it through. Take a break, have some chai, and celebrate with your friends and family. The next adventure is waiting! And remember, these marks are just one part of your journey, not the whole destination. Don't let 85 marks in Social Science define you!
